metadata.title: CVE-2017-9992 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the decode_dds1 function in libavcodec/dfa.cin FFmpeg before 2.8.12, 3.0.x before 3.0.8, 3.1.x before 3.1.8, 3.2.xbefore 3.2.5, and 3.3.x before 3.3.1 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9992` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.6-1
libav-tools - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.2.6-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.2.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.6-1').
